did.abstract: The collection contains preliminary and original art created by Ed Young as illustrations for children's books.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ed Young was born 28 November 1931 in China, were he lived until came to the United States to attend college. He attended Art Center College in Los Angeles and the Pratt Institute (Brooklyn, NY). Young later taught in the Visual Communications Department of the Pratt Institute for seven years.
The Emperor and the Kite, illustrated by Young, was a Caldecott Honor Book in 1968; and The Girl who loved the Wind, also illustrated by Young, was in the Childrenâ€™s Book Showcase in 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains preliminary and original art created by Young and used in the publication of children's books. A few pieces of correspondence are included in the collection. Some of the pieces are framed or under Plexiglas.
A complete list of titles is available, as well as a searchable database of the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials were boxed according to type of artwork (preliminary or original) with the exception of the oversize and framed pieces.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to children's literature and associated artwork. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
